meanings.definition: A selection from the Prophets read in synagogue as part of Jewish worship.
meanings.sent1: During the service, the rabbi read the haftarot aloud to the congregation.
meanings.sent2: The haftarot are important readings that complement the Torah portion.
meanings.sent3: The haftarot seemed to whisper ancient wisdom to the listeners.
meanings.sent4: Her voice echoed through the synagogue, carrying the haftarot to every corner.
meanings.sent5: The haunting melody of the haftarot lingered in the air long after the service ended.
